alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 19 at 9:29PM CDT until April 19 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CLEVELAND AND NORTHWESTERN POTTAWATOMIE COUNTIES... At 929 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Pink, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Eastern Norman and Pink. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
